headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Lower As Traders Slash Rate-Cut Bets; Nvidia Holds To $5 Trillion Mark
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in the red in Wednesday's mixed close after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said there's no certainty of another 2025 cut in interest rates.  Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

content.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Lower As Traders Slash Rate-Cut Bets; Nvidia Holds To $5 Trillion Mark
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in the red in Wednesday's mixed close after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said there's no certainty of another 2025 cut in interest rates.  Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

headline: AI Frenzy Is Spreading Over to Caterpillar and Oil Frackers
summary: Power generators and turbines, which keep data centers running, have become a dominant driver for the company as demand for artificial-intelligence infrastructure takes off globally.  Caterpillar told investors on Wednesday that sales of those products jumped 31% in its latest quarter, trouncing sales growth for its more traditional equipment.  For instance, shares of ProPetro Holding Corp., a West Texas oil contractor, soared an eye-popping 44% Wednesday after saying it was expanding its business to supply electricity to data centers.

content.title: AI Frenzy Is Spreading Over to Caterpillar and Oil Frackers
content.summary: Power generators and turbines, which keep data centers running, have become a dominant driver for the company as demand for artificial-intelligence infrastructure takes off globally.  Caterpillar told investors on Wednesday that sales of those products jumped 31% in its latest quarter, trouncing sales growth for its more traditional equipment.  For instance, shares of ProPetro Holding Corp., a West Texas oil contractor, soared an eye-popping 44% Wednesday after saying it was expanding its business to supply electricity to data centers.

headline: Nvidia Just Got Overtaken As No. 1 Dow Jones Stock In 2025
summary: Nvidia is soaring on Wednesday, but it still just got overtaken by Caterpillar as the No. 1 Dow Jones stock this year.  Caterpillar's power equipment sales for data centers helped the company better known for its construction equipment crush estimates in Q3, even though tariff costs dragged profit lower from a year ago.  CAT stock is the top Dow performer early Wednesday, followed by Nvidia, which became the first $5 trillion company.

content.summary: Nvidia is soaring on Wednesday, but it still just got overtaken by Caterpillar as the No. 1 Dow Jones stock this year.  Caterpillar's power equipment sales for data centers helped the company better known for its construction equipment crush estimates in Q3, even though tariff costs dragged profit lower from a year ago.  CAT stock is the top Dow performer early Wednesday, followed by Nvidia, which became the first $5 trillion company.

headline: Caterpillar shares jump as resilient demad fuels Q3 earnings beat
summary: Investing.com -- Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) reported better-than-expected third-quarter results on Wednesday, as the heavy equipment manufacturer saw sales rise 10% YoY, driven by resilient demand across its business segments. Shares surged 4.9% following the announcement.

content.title: Caterpillar shares jump as resilient demad fuels Q3 earnings beat

headline: Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) Delivers Impressive Q3
summary: Construction equipment company Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.5% year on year to $17.64 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.95 per share was 9.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) Delivers Impressive Q3
content.summary: Construction equipment company Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.5% year on year to $17.64 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.95 per share was 9.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Caterpillar: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Irving, Texas-based company said it had net income of $4.88 per share. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs, came to $4.95 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Caterpillar: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The Irving, Texas-based company said it had net income of $4.88 per share. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs, came to $4.95 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Cat Financial Announces Third-Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Cat Financial reported third-quarter 2025 revenues of $926 million, an increase of $38 million, or 4%, compared with $888 million in the third quarter of 2024. The increase in revenues was primarily due to a favorable impact from higher average earning assets of $56 million, partially offset by an unfavorable impact from lower average financing rates of $15 million. Third-quarter 2025 profit was $134 million, a decrease of $3 million, or 2%, compared with $137 million profit in the third quarter

content.title: Cat Financial Announces Third-Quarter 2025 Results
content.summary: Cat Financial reported third-quarter 2025 revenues of $926 million, an increase of $38 million, or 4%, compared with $888 million in the third quarter of 2024. The increase in revenues was primarily due to a favorable impact from higher average earning assets of $56 million, partially offset by an unfavorable impact from lower average financing rates of $15 million. Third-quarter 2025 profit was $134 million, a decrease of $3 million, or 2%, compared with $137 million profit in the third quarter

headline: Trump-Xi Meeting, Microsoft Earnings, Fed Rate Decision: Still to Come This Week
summary: President Trump is poised to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, following constructive weekend trade talks between Washington and Beijing. Investors will also tune into earnings from Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, plus the first Federal Reserve policy-setting meeting since the government shutdown began.

content.title: Trump-Xi Meeting, Microsoft Earnings, Fed Rate Decision: Still to Come This Week
content.summary: President Trump is poised to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, following constructive weekend trade talks between Washington and Beijing. Investors will also tune into earnings from Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, plus the first Federal Reserve policy-setting meeting since the government shutdown began.
